knimeNode.name: Align pharmacophores
knimeNode.shortDescription: Align query pharmacophores to reference pharmacophore.

intro.p: Align the query pharmacophores to the reference pharmacophores. This node computes the aligned query pharmacophore, the transformation matrix and Root-mean-square deviation (RMSD).

Algorithm:
Find candidate pairs points between probe and reference
Find biggest network of pairs, using BronKerbosch clique detection algorithm
Calculate optimal translation and rotation using Kabsch algorithm
.

fullDescription.option: The input column of table 1 with Query Pharmacophores to be aligned.
The input column of table 2 with Reference Pharmacophore to base the alignment on.

tab.name: Advanced Options
tab.option: Tolerance threshold for considering two distances to be equivalent
Break when set number of cliques is found
Number of cliques of each query pharmacophore to align
By default the only the best alignment of each query pharmacophore is returned. By turning this option on the alignments of all cliques will be returned.
Include the reference pharmacophore in output. Usefull when multiple reference pharmacophores are given.

ports.inPort: The table with pharmacophores to be aligned.
The table with the reference pharmacophore to base the alignment on.
ports.outPort: Aligned pharmacophores with transformation matrix and RMSD.
